means: 使惊讶，使大为吃惊(astonish的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: I was astonished at the backwardness of our country at the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们国家当时的落后程度让我感到震惊。

sentence.Network_en: "I'll be astonished if I win on Sunday," laughed Lyle.
sentence.Network_cn: “我要是星期天能赢那就真是奇了怪了，”莱尔笑道。

sentence.Network_en: They were astonished to find the driver was a six-year-old boy.
sentence.Network_cn: 令他们吃惊的是，开车的居然是个6岁的小男孩。

encyclopedia.content: 基本释义 v.使惊讶，使大为吃惊（astonish的过去式和过去分词） adj.吃惊的相关词 astonish vt.使惊讶，使吃惊近义词 astounded 动词astound的过去式 ...amazed adj. 吃惊的，惊愕的；... surprised adj.惊讶的；动词sur ...flabbergasted 动词flabbergast... shocked adj.震惊的；动词sho ...dumbfounded adj.惊呆的；动词dum... stupefied adj. 发愣的，目瞪口呆 ...aghast adj.惊骇的，吓呆的 dumbstruck adj.被吓得目瞪口呆的

entry.tran: 感到惊讶的;十分惊奇的
entry.def: If you are astonished by something, you are very surprised about it.

example.ex: I was astonished by his stupidity...
example.tran: 他的愚笨让我大跌眼镜。

example.ex: They were astonished to find the driver was a six-year-old boy.
example.tran: 令他们吃惊的是，开车的居然是个6岁的小男孩。

means.word_mean: 1. filled with the emotional impact of overwhelming surprise or shock;

sentences.sentence: "an amazed audience gave the magician a standing ovation"
"I stood enthralled, astonished by the vastness and majesty of the cathedral"
"astounded viewers wept at the pictures from the Oklahoma City bombing"
"stunned scientists found not one but at least three viruses"

auth_sentence.content: I'm just astonished you think it not so.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm just astonished you think it not so.

auth_sentence.content: I was astonished at the appalling ignorance displayed therein.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was astonished at the appalling ignorance displayed therein.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was astonished at the appalling ignorance displayed therein.

auth_sentence.content: He faced adverse criticism with an equanimity which astonished me.
auth_sentence.res_content: He faced adverse criticism with an equanimity which astonished me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He faced adverse criticism with an equanimity which astonished me.

Sentence.sentence: She was astonished by the professional possibilities afforded to young American woman.
